title: Artificial Intelligence for reverse engineering: application to detergents using Raman spectroscopy. (arXiv:2310.20254v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: The reverse engineering of a complex mixture, regardless of its nature, has become significant today. Being able to quickly assess the potential toxicity of new commercial products in relation to the environment presents a genuine analytical challenge. The development of digital tools (databases, chemometrics, machine learning, etc.) and analytical techniques (Raman spectroscopy, NIR spectroscopy, mass spectrometry, etc.) will allow for the identification of potential toxic molecules. translated_title: 逆向工程中的人工智能：应用于用拉曼光谱法检测洗涤剂
translated_abstract: 无论其性质如何，对复杂混合物进行逆向工程已经变得非常重要。能够快速评估与环境相关的新商业产品的潜在毒性对于分析学来说是一项真正的挑战。数字工具的发展（数据库、化学计量学、机器学习等）和分析技术（拉曼光谱法、近红外光谱法、质谱等）将允许鉴定潜在的有毒分子。本文以洗涤剂产品为例，其组成对人类或环境来说可能具有危险性，为了质量控制和监管目的，需要进行精确的鉴定和定量分析。通过结合各种数字工具（光谱数据库、混合数据库、实验设计、化学计量学/机器学习算法...）、不同的样品制备方法（原始样品或几种浓缩/稀释样品）和拉曼光谱法，我们可以实现这一目标。
tldr: 本研究使用人工智能和拉曼光谱法对洗涤剂进行逆向工程，以快速评估其潜在毒性，并为质量控制和监管提供精确的鉴定和定量分析。
en_tdlr: This paper utilizes artificial intelligence and Raman spectroscopy for reverse engineering of detergents, enabling quick assessment of their potential toxicity and providing accurate identification and quantification for quality control and regulation.
